document.discussion_title: Coach Fabin lauds U17 players for reaching AJC qualifiers final round
document.topic_text: Print This Coach Paa Kwesi Fabin Black Starlets coach Paa Kwasi Fabin has praised his players for qualifying for the next stage of the African Junior Championship qualifiers. Ghana lost 4-1 to Burkina Faso in the second leg on Saturday but qualified on a 6-5 aggregate scoreline. “I think it was a good match, I must congratulate Burkina Faso they played a very good game, but then we have to really fight hard, we need to qualify from this stage,” he told reporters after the match. The Black Starlets will play Ivory Coast in the final qualifier to decide which nation joins the final six teams to join host nation Madagascar next year. Courtesy of GHANAsoccernet.com - Ghana's leading football news website. Click for more news.
